#example return
check <- function(x) {
  if (x > 0) {
    result <- "Positive"
  }
  else if (x < 0) {
    result <- "Negative"
  }
  else {
    result <- "Zero"
  }
  return(result)
}

#exercise 2 exam
CalculateMeanGrade<-function()
  {grade=matrix(c(4.5,6,9,8,2,4,7,7,5,3,1,7),nrow=6,ncol=2)
  colnames(grade)=c("Ex1","Ex2")
  exam1=0
  exam2=0
  exam3=0
  exam4=0
  meangrade=c()
  for( i in 1:nrow(grade))
    {if(grade[i,1]<5)
      exam1=exam1+1
    if(grade[i,2]<5)
      exam2=exam2+1
    if((grade[i,1]<5) | (grade[i,2]<5))
exam3=exam3+1
if((grade[i,1]<5) & (grade[i,2]<5))
  exam4=exam4+1
    
    meangrade=c(meangrade,((grade[i,1]+grade[i,2]/2)))
  }
  print(grade)
  print(exam1)
  print(exam2)
  print(exam3)
  print(exam4)
  print(meangrade)
}

reversevector<-
  {vector1=c(2,6,1,4,5,7)
  vector2=c(7,5,4,1,6,2)
  i=1
  b=length(vector2)
  while(i<=length(vector1)) & (b>=1) & (same=TRUE)
  {if(vector1[i]==vector2[b])
    i=i+1
    b=b-1
    same=TRUE
  }
  else
    same=FALSE
  }
if(same==TRUE)
  print("vectors are the same")
else
  print("vector are different")}
